data.text: These were the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron:
the third was Absalom the son of Maacah daughter of King Talmai of Geshur;
the fifth was Shephatiah by Abital;
These six sons were born to David in Hebron, where he reigned seven years and six months.
and these sons were born to him in Jerusalem:

David’s other sons were Ibhar,3:6 Hebrew does not include David’s other sons were. Elishua,3:6 Two Hebrew manuscripts (see also 2 Samuel 5:15 and 1 Chronicles 14:5); most Hebrew manuscripts Elishama Eliphelet,
Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet—nine in all.
These were all the sons of David, besides the sons by his concubines. And Tamar was their sister.
Solomon’s son was Rehoboam:
Joram 3:11 Joram is a variant spelling of Jehoram. his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,
Amaziah his son, Azariah 3:12 Azariah is also called Uzziah; see 2 Chronicles 26:1. his son, Jotham his son,
Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
Amon his son, and Josiah his son.
The sons of Josiah:
The successors of Jehoiakim:
The descendants of Jeconiah the captive:
Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
The sons of Pedaiah:
and five others: Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed.
The descendants of Hananiah:
The six descendants of Shecaniah were Shemaiah and his sons:
The sons of Neariah:
The sons of Elioenai:
